intro: Kielmeyera oreophila, commonly known as the mountain kielmeyera, is a species of flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a small to medium-sized tree that typically grows in humid, shaded environments within montane forests. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in axillary inflorescences. Kielmeyera oreophila plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
